resources: BuildX You built and installed an app using Buildity! Xml Java Relative Layout Linear Layout H Linear Layout V Edit Text Text View ImageView ProgressBar RecyclerView WebView //Builder Install Prompt Allow Apk Installation The only source for new apps that your device knows is your app store. But this app is going to build a app for you right here on your device. To install that new app, you need to tell your device to allow installation of apps from unknown sources. \n\nEnabling Unknown Sources does not allow apps to be installed without your explicit case by case consent. You will still be shown a list of special permissions requested by an app and asked if you want to install it. You should always pay close attention to the permissions list, especially if you\'re allowing unknown sources. \n\nClicking "OK" will take you to the settings screen where you can check the box to allow "Unknown Sources." 1. Add your choice firebase library\n2. Add your google-services file to {project}/app/\n {{appName}} Installed Open Done Installation failed. Please do not navigate away from install screen. retry There is no apk to install. Please try again. Building Apk Done building {{appName}} Failed to build {{appName}} Tap here to install Failed to unpack aapt. \n\nDid the developer forget to include it in the assets folder? Failed to unpack android.jar. \n\nDid the developer forget to include it in the assets folder? Failed to sign apk key Project Settings Project Libraries Terms and Condition Privacy Policy Visit Website The following screens will guide you through the process of creating a new keystore, private-key, and self-signed certificate that can be used to sign apps for publishing on Google Play. To create a new key in an existing keystore, return to the previous screen and long-press on a keystore entry, then select "Create Key" from the context menu. Don\'t forget the password you choose for your key during this process. Also, be sure to backup the keystore file. If you ever forget the key password or lose the keystore file, you won\'t be able to publish updates to your apps. The default values shown on the following screens will create a suitable key for signing apps. Create New Keystore and Key Keystore Password Verify Password Key Name/Alias Key Password Verify Password Cancel Continue Certificate Info Validity (years) Certificate Signature Algorithm Please fill in the following information to identify yourself and/or your company. This information is contained in the public certificate paired with the key, and is included in the signatures generated with this key. You can put whatever you want in the following fields, and leave some blank if desired. Your Name Department/Unit Company/Organization Street Address State/Province City/Locality Country Code Invalid validity. Please enter a positive decimal value. Missing Info Please fill out at least the \'Your Name\' field. Validity Warning Google recommends a certificate validity period of 25 years or more for signing Android apps. Finish OK Continue Anyway Overwrite File? %s already exists. Overwrite? Passwords Don\'t Match Password Required A key password is required. Keystore Password Required Alias Required Wrong Keystore Password Key Name Conflict An entry with name %s already exists in the keystore. Creating Keystore more flexibility, more freedom Open Goto Line Settings Run
